docs.title: Risk Calculator
docs.text:
This small site provides two interactive calculators you can use to justify investments in backups, hot sites, and other BCDR options.

Sections

  • CISO Budget Defense — calculate Cold vs Hot site costs and generate a polished PDF you can share with executives.
  • Small Business Reality Check — see how SLE and ALE behave even with low ARO when exposure is high.

docs.title: About
docs.text: This is a small example site created with MkDocs and the Material theme. Customize this page with your project's information.

docs.title: Small Business Reality Check
docs.text:
Help small business owners understand how even a low-probability event can have a large Annual Loss Expectancy (ALE).

Use Case: A small retailer thinks "Hackers won't target me." Select your sector (Retail), set your asset value and exposure factor (how much you'd lose without backups), and the tool will compute SLE and ALE and produce a printable PDF.

Sector: Retail Healthcare Finance Manufacturing Asset value at risk (USD): Exposure Factor (EF %): (100% = no backups) Revenue (Optional): Annualized Rate of Occurrence (ARO): (years^-1) — populated from sector data by default BCDR Strategy Cold Site Warm Site Hot Site Controls Checklist (PPT Framework) Multi-Factor Auth (Technology) — reduces ARO by 50% Staff Phishing Training (People) — reduces ARO by 20% Succession Planning (Procedure) — reduces downtime cost by 10% Include DR annual cost in ROSI calculation (checked = include) Calculate Download PDF Risk Calculator Small Business Reality Check — ALE Report Inputs Results Enter values and click Calculate to see results. Money saved by BCDR: — Inherent vs Residual Risk Sensitivity: ALE vs Exposure Factor (EF) Sensitivity: ALE vs ARO Signature Date: Data sources

Sector values (ARO, AvgBreachCost, DowntimeCostPerHour) are hardcoded in the application for demonstration. Replace with your authoritative dataset or update docs/assets/js/sector-data.js to point at external sources.

  • SECTOR_DATA: internal benchmark dataset (editable)
  • DR_STRATEGIES: internal BCDR assumptions
